cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking generally northward, expected to make landfall in the western Florida Panhandle today, then move inland through Alabama, Georgia, the southern Appalachians and into the Mid-Atlantic later in the week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City / Apalachicola)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and tropical-storm watches/warnings confined to the Florida Panhandle coast from Navarre eastward to Wakulla/Jefferson Co. line and Indian Pass–Yankeetown.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge warning Indian Pass–Yankeetown FL; Tropical-storm warning Navarre FL–Wakulla/Jefferson Co. line.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle, Big Bend, and adjacent northern Gulf Coast; inland Alabama–Georgia and southern Appalachians later.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: No Boston entry in wind-probability table
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast 2–4 inches Mid-Atlantic; lower amounts expected in coastal New England)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds not expected at Boston; breezy conditions (<34 kt) possible late week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston because the center remains inland while passing well to the west.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate rain (1–3 inches) possible Thu–Fri as remnant moisture moves through New England; localized ponding in poor-drainage areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated thunderstorms and short-fused spin-up risk inland to the west of Boston, but direct tornado threat at the port is minimal.
